thread.title: Christmas temperatures could soar to one of hottest on record in ATL
thread.title_full: Christmas temperatures could soar to one of hottest on record in ATL

author: Irene Wright
title: Christmas temperatures could soar to one of hottest on record in ATL
text:
Christmas Day will be hot in Atlanta. See the Top 10 hottest holidays
Irene Wright
As parts of the country keep their fingers crossed for a white Christmas, the southeast could see some of the warmest temperatures ever on Christmas Day.
Atlanta has had some hot years, with the warmest Christmas on record since the 1920s reaching 75 degrees in 2015.
Here's what to expect over the next 10 days.
Atlanta's 10-day forecast
As of 7:20 a.m. on Dec. 18, the city of Atlanta is heading for the record books with a forecasted 72 degree day on Christmas.
Here's the full 10-day forecast:
- Dec. 19: High of 54/ low of 30, sunny
- Dec. 20: High of 64/ low of 42, sunny
- Dec. 21: High of 66/ low of 36, partly sunny
- Dec. 22: High of 58/ low of 36, partly sunny
- Dec. 23: High of 64/ low of 50, partly sunny
- Christmas Eve Day: High of 72/ low of 51, partly sunny
- Christmas Day: High of 72/ low of 52, partly sunny
- Dec. 26: High of 72/ low of 51, mostly cloudy
- Dec. 27: High of 71/ low of 50, partly sunny
- Dec. 28: High of 62/ low of 41, partly sunny
10 hottest Christmases in Atlanta
If the temperature does pop up into the 70s, it will be in the top 10 hottest Christmas Days in Atlanta.
- 2015: 75 degrees
- 2016: 74 degrees
- 1987: 72 degrees
- 1982: 71 degrees
- 1955: 70 degrees
- 1932: 70 degrees
- 2021: 69 degrees
- 1964: 69 degrees
- 1971: 66 degrees
- 1944: 66 degrees
Atlanta's Christmas Day records
The city dipped to its lowest Christmas temperature of 0 degrees in 1983. Typically, the city averages in the mid-50s on Christmas Day.
The most snow ever seen in Atlanta on Dec. 25 happened in 2010 when there was 1.3 inches on the ground.
Atlanta saw the most rain ever for a Christmas day in 1945 with more than 2 inches flooding the city.
Irene Wright is the Atlanta Connect reporter with USA Todayâ€™s Deep South Connect team. Find her on X @IreneEWright or email her at ismith@usatodayco.com.
